review_content:
33cl Bottle @ Erasmus Bruin Cafe, Salamanca.
Golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, hops, slightly herbal.
Taste follows the aroma.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Can -pours a clear amber-gold with a 2 finger puffy white cap that lasts....demure aromas of malts and dried grass, some earthiness...has a bright lager character with a sharp mouth feel...flavor hs malts and hops in balance up front then gores to a dryer hoppier clean finish...a decent lager for sessioning by a mega-brewer...enjoyable, drinkable and tasty
Amber clear with medium creamy white head. Slightly sweet malty aroma. Dry bitter taste with some sourness,  some roasty notes.

Cor âmbar com reflexos dourados, mais densa, espuma branca de média persistência. Aromas frutados, laranja, tangerina e fruta amarela de caroço como pessego, alperces e ameixa madura, alguma sensação metálica,. Boca com volume médio, fresco, novamente a fruta citrina e amarela de caroço, textura cremosa, ligeiro doce, nao icomodativo, carbonação equilibrada e final prolongado.

440 ml can. Pours clear golden color with white head. Aroma of hops, with notes of yeast and mild grassy hints.The taste is bitter, hoppy with herbal notes and sweetish notes of yeast and malt. Bitter aftertaste with notes of essential oil.

Robe or sombre limpide, mousse moyenne, mais disparaît assez vite, reste un résidu sur le bord du verre, belle carbo irrégulière. Nez houblonné, herbacé, avec un léger côté biscuité. En bouche, attaque légère, suivie d'une certaine rondeur biscuitée, pain très légèrement grillé, gros côté herbacé avec une amertume quand même relative. Ne ressemble pas tellement à une lager. C'est pas mauvais du tout, sans être fou, c'est pas mal subtil pour une indus.
Amber color. Excellent foam. Nose. Hop, herbaceous fruity light malt. Taste. Sweetish. Clean, lager character. Malt, biscuit, fruity notes, and a herbal hop aftertaste. A very decent hopped lager!
Tap. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is fruity hops, mild grains, not too intense. Taste is the same. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Alright.

Nagy, hófehér, tartós hab, borostyán szín. Lágeres, visszafogott, de határozott illat. Intenzív virágos, barackos, kissé citrusos izvilág, az ipari lágerekre jellemző olajos és enyhén kénes jelleg nélkül. Száraz, kozepesen szénsavas, közepesen kesernyés. kellemes, kifejezetten friss sör.

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma bianco sporco fine media persistenza, colore oro limpido, al naso malto cereali agrumi luppoli, in bocca è fruttata malto pane e agrumi, corpo leggero, carbonazione moderata, dolce con amaro percettibile. Buona aromatica ben luppolata per lo stile. Una Lager diversa. Mi piace. c. Carrefour Germignaga 04.07.20

bardzo dobry lager, zaskakujace, bardzo chmielny, klasyczny, wytrawny, malo slodowosci, nie dominuje, a jest ukryta, taki old schoolowy lager, z piekna czapa trwalej piany. no lagerek lepszy niz swego czasu pity harp, zaskakujaco dobre jak na lagerowy styl.

On peut dire ce que l'on veut...Guiness est pour moi synonyme de Stout et ce n'est pas cette Lager qui va me faire changer d'avis. Vous me direz qu'il est bien que des brasseries historiques comme celle-ci augmente son champ d'action au lieu de se reposer sur ses lauriers. Mais je pense qu'ils auraient mieux à faire en restant sur les stouts, voire à aller sur les Black IPA. Mais suis-je bête...la vente avant tout ! N'attendez rien de sensationnel donc ici, pour cette Hop House 13 Lager qui ne vous surprendra pas pour sa présence en bouche, ni pas sa complexité aromatique. Celle-ci est néanmoins globalement appréciable avec des accents de chouchen, surtout présent au nez et qui se retrouve de façon plus modérée à la dégustation. Le visuel est sur un blond doré soutenu parfaitement limpide, sans mousse. Au nez, le chouchen domine (alcool breton à base de miel pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas), avec du caramel et des céréales. A la dégustation, l'attaque est insipide, avec un petit côté caramel qui est là pour nous rappeler que nous ne sommes pas en train de boire de l'eau pétillante. La deuxième bouche, sans être beaucoup plus goutue, a une petite présence douceâtre avec de légers arômes de biscuit. Ce n'est pas l'arrière bouche qui nous égaye davantage. La troisième bouche arrive donc à point nommé pour ne pas nous morfondre complètement. On y retrouve les arômes du nez, le chouchen en retrait, avec cependant une intensité limitée et un alcool, à 5 % très limité. Le final...pas vu ! Une chose est certaine, dans un pub, à Dublin, je ne demanderai jamais une Hop House 13 Lager !

Aroma; pale malts, grass, nectarine, syrup, caramel.  Look; normal off white head on clear bright golden body. Taste; mild sweet malts, grass, fruit syrup, caramel.  Malted cardboard in finish. Feel; normal body n co². Overall; heard news about this being discontinued. Well, that's no crisis.
[bottle 33cl from last year t@home nearby PivotekaH7]

Bottle at home.  Clear golden coloured. Malty, slight toastiness, caramel, grainy. Fairly dry.

Purchased at Carrefour

330ml bottle at home from store. Pours clear pale copper with thin white head and some lacing. Aroma of subtle, fruity hops and malt. Taste is mostly malt, nice bittering floral hops finish with hints of fruits, mostly apricot but light enough on the hops. Nice bitter in the finish. A bit watery and moderate taste. Nothing incredible but i'm liking it more than similar, less hoppy lagers. Easy drinking nice bitter.
33cl Bottle @ Erasmus Bruin Cafe, Salamanca. Golden colour with a thin white head.…

Can -pours a clear amber-gold with a 2 finger puffy white cap that lasts....demure aromas of malts and dried grass, some earthiness...has a bright lager character with a sharp mouth feel...flavor hs malts and hops in balance up front then gores to a dryer…
Amber clear with medium creamy white head. Slightly sweet malty aroma. Dry bitter taste with some sourness,  some roasty notes.

Cor âmbar com reflexos dourados, mais densa, espuma branca de média persistência. Aromas frutados, laranja, tangerina e fruta amarela de caroço como pessego, alperces e ameixa madura, alguma sensação metálica,. Boca com volume médio, fresco,…

440 ml can. Pours clear golden color with white head. Aroma of hops, with notes of yeast and mild grassy hints.The taste is bitter, hoppy with herbal notes and sweetish notes of yeast and malt. Bitter aftertaste with notes of essential oil.

Amber color. Excellent foam. Nose. Hop, herbaceous fruity light malt. Taste. Sweetish. Clean, lager character. Malt, biscuit, fruity notes, and a herbal hop aftertaste. A very decent hopped lager!
Tap. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is fruity hops, mild grains, not too intense. Taste is the same. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Alright.

Nagy, hófehér, tartós hab, borostyán szín. Lágeres, visszafogott, de határozott illat. Intenzív virágos, barackos, kissé citrusos izvilág, az ipari lágerekre jellemző olajos és enyhén kénes jelleg nélkül. Száraz, kozepesen szénsavas, közepesen kesernyés.…

Aroma; pale malts, grass, nectarine, syrup, caramel. Look; normal off white head on clear bright golden body. Taste; mild sweet malts, grass, fruit syrup, caramel. Malted cardboard in finish. Feel; normal body n co². Overall; heard news about this being…
Bottle at home. Clear golden coloured. Malty, slight toastiness, caramel, grainy. Fairly dry.…

330ml bottle at home from store. Pours clear pale copper with thin white head and some lacing. Aroma of subtle, fruity hops and malt. Taste is mostly malt, nice bittering floral hops finish with hints of fruits, mostly apricot but light enough on the hops. Nice…

Bottle of 33cl, in a Tulip glass; from the fridge.

We're in front of a clear pale kinda copper coloured beer. Nice carbonation.

Aroma and first taste have subtle hoppy notes, then more malt tones come. Refreshing.
Bottle. Clear pale copper color with a thin frothy off-white head. Mild, sugary aroma of grain with notes of honey. Mild taste. Some floral notes. Thin body.
Pours a clear dark golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, malt, some grassy notes. Maltiness dominates.
Aspetto dorato con schiuma pannosa bianco crema, abbastanza persistente. Aroma speziato, resinoso, leggermente agrumato. Gusto dolce in principio e poi amaro con retrolfatto speziato.
Clear, amber color and a white head. Nose is bready, malty, decent hoppy. Taste follows the nose.

Old rating from 12-04-16 - 330ml bottle. Pours a golden colour with a white foamy head & lively carbonation. Aromas of grain & malt. Tastes of much of the same especially malt. A fair amount of malt & hops in the aftertaste. Overall not terrible, but then not something I have a second off.

A hoppy aromatic Lager. Clear ambered gold color, with an average and quite stabile white head. The aroma is pleasantly full of hop, pizza dough, flowers, grass and yellow fruits, in particular peach. The taste is in line with the aroma, with the dominance of cereals, yellow fruits and a well balanced hoppy bitterness, reminescent of herbs and edible flowers. The body is quite watery, with a decent carbonation and a really vague alcoholic taste. Considering its generally commercial nature, this product positively surprised me, as it is well balanced and easy to enjoy, although obviously far from being a special one.
Decent, better than the average lager but nothing special. As the name suggests there is a pleasant hoppy flavour, with the malt fading into peach at the end.
Fijne ronde, licht kruidige smaak, prima te behappen na een lange dag. Aroma is wat licht.

Piana ciemno biała, lekko w kierunku jak kożuch, nietrwała, średnia, szyła na szkle, zredukowała się do niewysokiej warstwy na powierzchni. Kolor przejrzysty bursztynowy. Aromat uderza w pierwszym momencie żelazem, później jest ziołowo, troszkę za sprawą chmieli cytrusowo, do tego jeszcze siano, zboże. Smak jak dla mnie lekko przytykająca goryczka, z rodzaju tej mało atrakcyjnej - co może mieć przyczynę w użytym chmielu, niemniej jednak goryczka jest, do tego lekki posmak grejpfrutowy, cytryny, zioła ściąga podniebienie, niewielka kontra słodowa do tego. Ogólnie piwo nie jest może tragedią i utrzymuje się na takim średnim może z lekkim plusem poziomie.
This is a quite palatable mildly hopped ale, a good mass produced entry level to the world of hops

Aussehen: klares schönes Bernstein, kaum carbonisiert, weiße sehr flüchtige Krone

Aroma: minimal Herb und hopfen

Antrunk: Midtrunk: nachtrunk: industrie platt, leichtes herbheit und minimaler hopfen

Mundgefühl: mittler körper aber weichgespühlt

Fazit: typisches industriebier, nichts besonderes und so weichgespühlt das jedr es trinken kann...
Best widely available beers ie heineken carlsberg or bud. Would choose it over them! Easy to drink & more flavour!
Bevuta in bottiglia.  Ottima lager molto luppolata.  Leggero amaro finale. Ben equilibrata.
Une lager de grande consommation avec un arrière goût métallique et des houblons non identifiables. Dans le genre, préférer une Carlsberg.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with stable white head. Clear aroma of hops, with notes of yeast and mild grassy hints. Bitter, hoppy flavour with grassy notes and sweetish touches of yeast and malt. Bitter aftertaste with estery touches. Decent for the style, which is not my favourite.

Темно золотистое пиво с небольшой красивой пеной, которая неплохо держалась в бокале. Аромат не яркий и не запоминающийся. В аромате цветочные нотки (аромат полевых цветов, но очень бедный и не выраженный), немного фруктового аромата, и сладость солода. Хоть пиво и громко названо, Дом Хмеля - но какой либо мощной хмелевой нотки нет. Вкус сливочный, тягучий и совсем не хмелевой. Больше не куплю.
Ma io l'ho trovata assolutamente anonima e anche difficile da mandare giù...

#3847
Many thanks to Camons!
Clear, gold to pale amber, medium white head. Malty aroma, floral tones. Taste is lightly sweet and bitter, malty, floral, herbal, a bit papery. Medium body and carbonation.

Was a favourite beer of mine. Now with the 'improved recipe' I personaly find the depth that was so characteristic of this beer is gone. I can forgive the recent change from 5% to 4.6%, which many people may not have noticed as it was done in a sneaky way, but I am very dissapointed with the new flavour.
Hopfig fruchtig im Geruch. Im Glas ein eher dunkles Gold, wenig Schaum. Im Antrunk angenehm aromatisch-hopfig, bittert mild bis kaum nach. Fruchtige Aromen, leicht harzig. Fein carbonisiert, süffig.
10.10.2020 - 0.33l bottle from marktkauf, bb 05.2021, 0.96 eur. pours a clear deep golden  with a medium head. aroma of woody hops, toasted malts. flavour of bread, flowers, glue. not bad.

“Taste remastered” bottle from Morrison’s. ABV now 4.6% down from 5%, not sure when this change was made but it’s pretty obvious this “remastered” recipe is just an excuse for the brewery to cut costs. Having said that, the difference in taste is negligible, perhaps a little less depth of flavour than previously but it’s still a pleasant lager
Ciemnozłote, przejrzyste, ładna piana, lekko oblepiająca szkło. Zapach nieco estrowy, nuty owocowe i kwiatowe na słodowym tle. W smaku delikatnie słodkie, z przyjemnie zarysowaną goryczką.
More hoppy than I usually like but strangely not overpowering.  Not my first drink of choice but every now and again I like to partake especially if having a session on lighter crisper beers.
Bernstein. Die Farbe ist Geschmack! Ein bisschen Bernd ein bischen Stein! Betrunken vom Fass (tastehero)

Bernsteinfarbenes Bierchen mit kurzweiliger feinperligen Schaumkrone
Für Guinness recht leicht aber lecker.
Gezapft vom Flaschen-Fass (Taste Hero)

330ml bottle. Opaöescent, amber colour with average, thick, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Floral hoppy, minimally yeasty doughy, and slightly grainy, spicy, malty aroma. Taste is slightly bitter, floral hoppy, minimally yeasty doughy, slightly spicy malty, a touch of juniper and laurel; minimally metallic finish.
Watery texture, minimally metallic-repellent palate, medium prickly carbonation. 
Drinkable, refreshing - OK.
Bottle, 5.0%. Lagery aroma, hint of caramel. Clear dark golden colour. Unstable white head. The flavour is slightly bready with mild notes of a floral aroma hop. Good clean bitterness. Bready finish.

Bottle, local store. Clear golden, larger white head, ok lasting. Quite smelly grainy nose, not nice, really. Sharper bittery start, quite herbal. Again, not too nice. Lighterb ody. Drinkable, but that's it.
0,33 l Flasche. Bernsteinfarbenes Bier, Schaum baut schnell ab. Riecht muffig, schmeckt auch so, recht bitter.
Aroma : Lightly toasted cereal/corn grain. Hint of caramel malt, straw.  Taste : Watery body, moderately bitter throughout. Toasted corn/malt. Not nasty just very boring!
A Barley flavour funnily enough. Smooth easily drink able refreshing. A favourite at the moment since drinking few  pints at the local
Had this from a can in a hotel lounge in Inverness. Dominated by malt in both aroma and taste, crisp, very light hoppy finish
Possibly my favorite lager ever, has much personality but it's still very drinkable, it's really special. Just try it if you can

Can 0,44L. Clear golden color with a finger of creamy white head. Aroma of cookies, malts, light caramel. Taste is light sweet and malty,  aftertaste has some light bitternes, but it's hardly recognizable. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, slick texture. Maybe becouse it's Guinness, but I expected to be better...
De couleur dorée prononcée, cette Lager brassée par Guinness, possède une amertume métallique avec un bon équilibre acidité-amertume. On en redemande !

0,5 l can. Pours clear, deep golden with a finger of quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is quite fruity and flowery, malty, hay, but also quite metallic once head disappeared. Taste is medium sweet and low bitter. Body is quite watery. Finish is short and moderately hoppy. Drinkable.

In my view one of the most underated beers around, after years of searching, well months really, I've found a lager that has body and flavour and is worth putting your pint of ale down for. Due to this it generally won't appeal to diehard flavour intolerant lager drinkers and that's ok as the world is awash with crap beer for them to cherish.

Bottle 0.33l, trade with Camons, thanks! Clear, orange gold colored. AROMA- malty with toasted tones, apple, herbal, floral and spicy hops. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, slightly bitter, malty, apple, peach, floral, spicy and paper hops. Medium bodied. 
Drinkable.

Ciemnozłote, klarowne piwo o początkowo bardzo obfitej pianie, która z czasem redukuje się do mgiełki na powierzchni. Aromat słodu, ciasteczek i chmielu. W smaku podobne do dawnych polskich piw, czyli słód i chmiel. Goryczka średnia w stronę niskiej. Ogólnie całkiem przyjemny lager, wyraźnie czuć w nim chmiel.

0,33l bottle. Clear golden colour with medium size white foam on top. Malt aroma with gentle raisin. Malty taste, some sour vegetable, grain and hops. Something is bit rotten also. Lightly bitter finish with some rotten veges or something mouthfeel.

330 ml bottle. Clear dark golden, small fluffy head. Metallic notes, some malt and hay, a bit citrus. Metallic bitterness, slightly sour. Light to medium bodied, oily texture, lively carbonated, a bit unpleasant bitter finish.
Bier mit bisschen von allem. Würzig, grasiger Hopfen, leicht süßlicher Malz, fruchtig Säure. Gut trinkbar.
Aromat: słód, ciasteczka, chmiel i jabłka. Smak: słodowo-chmielowe. Goryczka niska do średniej. Pije się przyjemnie.

megbotránkoztató egy sör
először nagyüzemileg indul
aztán kicsit belesimul az angolos szénsavtalanságba
aztán meg érdektelenségbe.

330ml bottle, poured into pint shaker. A: Golden, clear, tiny thin head which disappeared straight away, didn't leave any lacing. S: British style earthy malts, hints of sour apples. T: Earthy, tangy, notes of slightly sour berries. M: Low to moderate carbonation, medium body. O: Combined elements of an English style Bitter with a euro style pale lager.

Light amber color, small white head. Aroma of malt, grain, hops, light citrus and fruity notes. Dry sweet taste with mild bitterness in finish and dry aftertaste. Thin body and good carbonation. Fine lager.
Com sabor a manga e pêssego, ótima cerveja. Com boa compostura, sente se sabor a cereal.
Une petite bière surprenante avec un goût appréciable. Une bien belle découverte.

650ml bottle. Pours a gold amber. Aroma of peach and hops. Flavour of malt, sugars and peach. Sweet initially but then leans to a slight bitter finish and dryness in the back of the throat. High carbonation at first but dissipates to medium quite quickly.  For a lager this is good and flavoursome.

29.05.2020
AR: hopfig, malzig,  langweilig
AP: klares goldgelb
TA: hopfig, malzig, langweilig
Im Aroma Honig, Rosmarin, Apfel, Williamsbirne, Zitrone, am Gaumen leicht süßlich, wenig bitter, sehr süffig mit spritziger Kohlensäure

Caída en copa con capa de espuma que deja rastro según desaparece muy poco a poco, bastante clara, translúcida, color amarillo intenso.
Aromas a malta en nariz, algo de lúpulo.
En boca es suave, una lager buena, refrescante y agradable, ligeramente afrutada tras los aromas reseñados. Tiene poca carbonatación, permitiendo el trago largo (aunque no lo recomendamos para poder disfrutarla). Ligeros toques herbáceos al tragar.
Bastante mejor que las lager españolas industriales más conocidas, pero hay que ver si la relación calidad-precio compensa para cada cual.

Tuesday, May 5, 2020. Can 44cL. 5%. Purchase ("Intermarché", Airvault (79), FR). Home. Noon quite thirsty. A golden yellow-orange clear beer with a medium white head ; short retention. Grain-cereal, herbal note. Light sweet, medium dry refreshing, bitter note ; short story. Light to medium body, thin texture, average gaseous, sweet grainy dry refreshing. Overall, ok.

Dieses helle Bier aus der berühmten Guinness-Brauerei ist benannt nach der Hausnummer des alten Brauhauses.
Ungewohnt, ein solches Bier zu finden, da man zwar überall das Stout findet, aber mein erstes Helles. Dementsprechend hoch waren die Erwartungen.
Es ist ein speziell gehopftes Lager, das aber nicht wirklich allzu besonders ist.
Man kann es gut trinken, aber vielmehr als ein Becks oder Ottakringer ist es auch nicht. Hier schafft man ein solides Bier, bei dem man ruhig etwas kreativer sein hätte können.
A light fruity aroma, some hops. The small creamy head disappears rather fast, the body is dark orange. A sweet taste, light malty and bread. The body is light, creamy with a normal carbonation.
33cl bottle, clear deep amber color, minimal persistent white head, malt aroma with bread, citrus and metallic notes, balanced flavor, medium body, smooth finish with straw and grass notes, drinkable

Home. 33 cl bottle. This beer has 4.1% ABV. A thin off-white foam layer on a pale-ale coloured beer. Aroma is light malty, some caramel, light fruity. Taste is somewhat sweet, light caramel. Upcoming fruity with some hops in aftertaste. Light peach and apricot. Somewhat light sticky. CO2 somewhat low.
Flasche 33cl. Rötlich-braun, klar. Gutes Schaumverhalten. Nase Malz, Nüsse. Erinnert optisch und sensorisch an Kilkenny, die untergärige Hefe passt. Dry-Hopped, fruchtig. Insgesamt ok.
0.44l can from Spar. It has normal foam and light co2. Taste is sweet apple, grain and some herbal hop. It isn't too bitter. Nice but pricy.

L:
-pours a clear golden-amber with a medium,foamy,white head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-sweet,malty,orange zest,grapefruit
T:
-light grapefruit,sweet,spicy,malty,apricot
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Pretty solid Entry level Lager from Guinness.Sort of a toned down version of Sam Adams Boston Lager.

clear darker golden colour, one inch of creamy white head; aroma of wet grains, herbal and moderate apple notes; taste of a hoppy lager with some slight apple and minimal citruses; quite ok lager with perfect appearance

17/04/2020
Looks: light amber color and small fast disappearing head. 
Aroma: biscuit malts, lemon, herbal, a little bit fruity. 
Taste: medium bitter, a little bit sweet, some citrus and tropical fruits, grassy, a little bit malty. The finish is dry and bitter.
Mouthfeel: light medium body with light to medium carbonation.
Overall: more hoppy and tasty than the previous review, but is starting to show some oxidation. Overall a very decent hoppy lager.
Rating: 3.6 / 5

20/03/2020
Looks: light amber color and small fast disappearing head. 
Aroma: corn, biscuity, lemon. 
Taste: medium bitter, some citrus hops, a little bit malty. The finish is dry with a bit of hop bitter presence.
Mouthfeel: medium light body with medium carbonation.
Overall: a different, refreshing and unique lager, but judging by the name it should have way more hops. I've had this before and it was a lot better than this (more hoppy).
Rating: 3.2 / 5

0.44l can with a Guinness logo on it. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Bready malts and some apples in the aroma. The taste has a bit more character than the aroma. Bready malts appear here too with a generous amount of spicy hops. Traces of grapefruit and apples show up too. Nothing spectacular here, but it's still drinkable.
can under the name "Guinness Hop House 13 Lager" @ shop (budapest), yellow colour, normal body, average carbonated, hoppy, slightly texture, not so interesting lager
Delicious lager beer. Nothing extraordinary yet unique in flavour. Recommended.

Aroma: light zesty hop, a little malt
Appearance: dark golden, white fluffy head and sudsy lacing
Flavour: light toffee, malt and a little hop
Palate: clean short finish
Tap (Three Sisters, Edinburgh). Clear amber color. Small size, white head, stays. As low as you can go. Ultimate shit in every aspect. Nope.

Look: foggy deep golden with a moderate white well-lacing head. Aroma: pilsner malt, minor special malts, light butterscotch, alpha sourness. Light to medium body. Taste: clean malts, spicy and somewhat grassy hops. Light plus bitterness. Decent being an industrial lager.
500 ml can poured at home. Pours golden with almost no head. Smells like berries of some sort. Taste is also sweet. Taste is sweet with heavy peach flavour. Actually not bad.
Recently introduced in the Kenyan market. Nice shaped unique bottle. Amber colored with nice head. Cool and refreshing with fruity aftertaste which I personally did not enjoy.

Cor amarillo dorado, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma a cereal, ligera humedad y notas herbales. Gusto a cereal, hierba fresca, ligeros pan,  humedad y piel de limón, amargor herbal. Cuerpo acuoso. Buena Pale Lager, con ciertos matices interesantes, de las mejores Pale Lager industriales que he probado.

On tap at the Dublin Airport. Pours a clear yellow gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has earthy hay and straw with a hint of wet grass backing. Flavor has light straw and hay with a touch of sweet grain underlying.

Taste- hops, refreshing (because its cold), some bitter notes with accompanying sweetness, not too hoppy, some malt. Generally decent and drinkable.

Not the product that you could expect from Guiness with notes of malt, caramel, extract of hop, watery, there is clearly a lack of aromas, not a master of art, drinkable with a gold body, clear, average carbonation, thin and white foam.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 34B: 2A/21A). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L92036F002 (BBF 19/05/20). AROMA: medium-low grainy aroma (corn-like) with a neutral profile. low background metallic note. very faint pine-like hop presence. APPEARANCE: deep gold to light copper color and cristal clear. medium-low off-white head with average retention. TASTE: similar to the aroma with medium-low grainy flavor, neutral, with medium bitterness. faint citrusy note. finishes dry and slightly bitter. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a kind of india pale lager where the hops have long gone.
Deep gold. Medium head with high retention. Aroma intensity 4/5. Honey, flowers, cooked vegetables and resin in the nose. Medium bitter. Light to medium body
Aroma of fruits and malt. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with average carbonation. Overall an OK Lager.

There’s flavour in there, but you need to work hard to find it. It’s like one of those thrillers that seems to be set permanently at night. It may be perfectly good if only we could see what’s happening

Golden with thick foamy lacy white head

Just returned from Ireland to Florida. One of the best beers ever. I hope it come to the US and Florida

2020 03 02. Published in boxed version at home as well. It has a nice amber color, its foam is yellowish white, huge when filled, and then fades quickly. Slightly boxed metallic scent, but delicious. It also has a metallic taste, but is more of a hop hop lager. Tiny is disembodied, but maybe even better than tapped outside.

Csapolt verzió,  Barcelona, Futballárium. Habja nem sok volt, illata finoman komlós, de maláta is érződik, csehes,  németes alapsör illat. Friss volt, így csapolva egy nagyon jó üdítő friss láger. Kis komlót még elbírt volna.
2020 03 02. Megjelent dobozos verzióban itthon is. Szép borostyán színe van, a habja sárgásfehér, kitöltéskor hatalmas, majd gyorsan apad. Kicsit dobozos fémes illat, de finom. Ízre is fémes, de mellette inkább komlósabb lager. Picikét testetlen, de talán még jobb, mint a csapolt kinti.
Soon get sick of this. Nice idea by them but it’s only being served everywhere because of the clout of the makers. It isn’t because if the quality.
The beer has got a clear amber color with a small head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of hops, bread,  honey, malt. Smooth finish.

33cl bottle at Finnegan's Harp in Nuremburg. Amber golden color. Light citrusy hop nose on a crackery malt base. Taste is honeyish malt with a hint of caramel. Light dry bitterness in finish. Tasted on 8/19/19.

330ml bottle brewed in Dublin at 5%. Light orange amber. Medium Guinness style microbubble smooth head. Corny, bready, lager aroma. Medium carbonation. One-note mild citrus hop flavour floats on top of a bready, savoury malt base. Very slight lingering bitterness. If you take the "hop" and "crafted" on the label too seriously, you will be seriously disappointed. On the other hand, as a lager with added hop kick, this is the ticket, and would serve as a great eye-opener to give to steadfast lager drinkers. No complaints, even if it doesn't do too much for me - a fine refresher, and unsurprisingly popular on tap.
Botella 0,33l  Color ambar,filtrada,espuma blanca,fina,alta,resistente.Aroma malta,caramelo,frutal.Sabor ligero dulzor con notas de suave amargor,malta,frutal,caramelo,bastante equilibrada y fresca.
Thuis uit een flesje, gekocht bij de Jumbo. Amberkleur, roomwit (weinig) schuim. De naam suggereert veel hop, maar ik vind het wat slapjes. Lekker, maar niet bijzonder.
Für ein Lager sehr angenehm in der Nase mit einer gewissen Hopfennote. Auch die Optik besticht durch eine Guinness ähnliche Schäumung. Mild, süffig, milde Bitterkeit. Sehr erfrischend.

Pint at the gravity bar. 
Brilliantly clear deep gold in color with a thin white head. 
Bready crackery maltiness with bits of floral spicy citrus hop. 
This was everywhere in Ireland and was a good choice when there wasn't something more interesting and your were tired of Guinness stout.

Color dorado transparente con espuma media blanca de retención y residuo medios. Aroma mineral, ligero óxido y lúpulos nobles. Sabor fresco a lúpulos nobles, frutas blancas y cereal poco malteado con notas a caramelo, cítricos y minerales. Amargor medio de regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media. Una Lager de perfil muy limpio, aroma regulero pero de sabor bastante fresco.
Hoppy with the feeling of a craft lager. Easy drink with quite a distinct after taste.
Inoffensive lager. Slight citrus aroma, gold lager with decent carbonation. Light bitterness and mid length finish.

Amber color bright lager. 
Light bodied. 
Honey and caramel notes. 
Medium bitter aftertaste

Botella de 33 cl @ Carrefour Zaragoza. 
Color ámbar, cristalina. Espuma escasa color blanca. Nula retención. 
Aromas a galleta, ligeras notas a caramelo. En boca es maltosa, especiada y ligeramente amarga. Me la esperaba peor.
Amber body with white head. Aroma is malts fruits herbs. Taste is malts biscuits. Aftertaste is malty.

Bottle 50cl. @The Station House, Blennerville, Tralee, poured into a lager glass. Clear medium golde, good frothy white head, half-way lastig, good lacing; rather weak aroma, sweet malt, grain, light grassy; taste medium sweet and slightly bitter, malty, grainy, light caramel, sweetbitter aftertaste; decent thirst quencher.
Women’s Word Cup Soccer, Beer one of many in Den Haag tonight.  Solid recommendation off the tap at Ocasey’s.

clear amber with a white head that stays. aroma is fruity hops. taste is dry, bitter, cascadey, one-dimensional. yes, i get it - hops, you have included them. something acidic about it, near-sulfury. all the poor bits of lager yeast included, none of the good bits. distinctly overcarbonated. extremely heavy handed attempt and would not get again.

Bottiglia. Al naso arrivano indizi di orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale, permanendo in maniera sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma resiste abbastanza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di aspetto cristallino e anche qui la grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine, con carbonazione vivace. Il colore è giallo dorato carico. Il corpo è rotondo. L'amaro è pronunciato. La forza gustativa è elevata e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di pronta beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di decente intensità. L'aroma in bocca porta i segni di caramello, miele, crosta di pane, frutta secca, erba, agrumi e mandarino.

Review: 500 ml bottle of Hop House Lager 13: 4.1% vol.

Have had this on tap and thought it wasn’t too bad to be fair to Guinness, so let's see what it’s like at home from the bottle.

Comes in a very nice dark brown bottle, with a very eye catching  “13” logo on show in red lettering, this double hopped lager definitely stands out.  

My bottle said 4.1% while on most reviews I see 5%. Bought it in Ireland where our government dont trust us with strong alcohol. 

Also from the bottle we can see that it is “named after the 100 year old building where hops are still stored at St James Gate”. 

Looks like a regular lager, small white head with a clear golden yellow colour. Head dies a little but does stick around a while.

Overall it looks ok, not bad, looks nourishing!

The smell is strong enough, a real lagery smell on the nose, quite strong. I am getting fresh hops, citrus, with a good bit of passion fruits. Stronger on the nose than what a regular lager tends to be be. Promising!

On the taste found it very, very hoppy. Well it is called hop house, but wasn’t expecting a “lager” to be so bitter. More an IPA really than a regular lager, I guess that’s all that double hopping then!!
Lagery taste on the fringes, the grainy malts there, but this is hop filled to the max. 

Bit dry in the mouth too while very strong in the hops, otherwise can get the citrus and light malts. If I really want to taste all those hops in a lager then I will just order a regular IPA! 

Hoppiness and that’s about it really, otherwise a very bland beer from Guinness, at least from the bottle.  

No real character or flavour, it is a very weak effort as a lager to rival the big boys. Just boring and not one to seek out what with so many to choose from these days.
De Carrefour. En copa Alhambra. Jugando a Hollow Knight. Lager bastante buena, con mas cuerpo del habitual y lupulo herbal tambien mas fresco de lo tipico

Typical light lager, but not a lot of flavour. clean and crisp as you’d expect, but easy. (3.3 June 2019) 

Retried, it has a clear hop presence, definitely a modern lager. Good flavour
Bottle - Golden yellow with decent white head.  High carbonation. Good mouthfeel.  Mild aroma. Quite tasty for lager - lasting finish.

33cl flesje gekregen voor verjaardag 
Alcoholpercentage van 5%
Uitgeschonken in Jopen glas
Als Guinness Hop House 13 Lager

Uiterlijk: goudoranje met goede vaste witte schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: neus is wat fruitig, smaak is moutig, licht hoppig, klein bittertje 

Conclusie: niet verkeerd voor een lager

La definirei come una Ipa lagerizzata. C'è un retrogusto fruttato un pò dolce che associo alla pesca, che si sposa bene con una discreta amarezza. Una birra sia beverina che interessante e un pò inconsueta.

I would classify this beer as a lagered Ipa. Fruity undertones reminds me peach and it combines well with a medium bitterness. A very drinkable and bit unusual beer.
Bouteille 33 cl couleur blonde petite mousse, odeur menthes, goût sur la coriandre, la menthe, houblon, pas mauvaise

Aspetto eccellente: chiara e limpida, caratterizzata da una (favolosa) densa schiuma che ricorda quella della classica stout Guinness. 
Aroma intenso dalle note floreali, ricorda pesca e albicocca; poco persistente. In bocca si apprezza un gusto maltato leggermente aromatico; il luppolo controbilancia il tutto ma l'amaro resta sullo sfondo. Corpo medio, molto beverina.
Ottima con un'ampia varietà di primi e per grandi bevute.
Non si possono che apprezzare esperimenti di tale tipo da parte di una grande industria, incentrati sull'innovazione e la qualità e non sul rincorrere le tendenze del mercato a puro fine economico. Altri birrifici dovrebbero imparare...

Bevuta alla spina. Colore giallo carico, leggermente velata. Aroma luppolato, poco percettibile. Il gusto a sorpresa dimostra un certo carattere, con il sapore amarognolo dei luppoli in evidenza. Tipica lager senza infamia ne lode, consistenza acquosa e beverina.
Something interesting behind the bar in amongst a load of standard bitters and old fashioned ipa's. It's hoppy as the name suggests and will do the job.
One of favourite beers that is as good in a bottle as it is from the cask....

Tap at scholars lounge, rome , italy.  Clear golden, smooth offwhite head. Aroma is mild and somewhat rubbery.  Flavor is malty sweet malty faint herbal hoppy note. Earthy rusty bitter note. No way this is a 90+ lager. 
Or they put on some shitty italian lager instead of the advertised.
It is very smooth , also nicely breadish. Hopping is disturbing (metallic, vomit)

Bottle, 0.50l. Aroma is bready, biscuity, grassy, floral and creamy. Pours clear pale amber color with medium sized soapy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Taste starts with light sweet caramel, following is mild fruity, grassy and slightly medicinal, mouthfeel is smooth, while finish is medium bitter. Light to medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation in palate. Deserve’s a Guinness name...

zapach przyjemny. słody, lekki, wytrawny karmel, sporo ziół, trochę wytrawnej sosny i dojrzałego jabłka, moreli. kolor głębokiego złota, klarowny, piana biała, średnio obfita, niespecjalnie trwała. w smaku dość wytrawne, przypieczony jasny chleb, odrobina wytrawnego karmelu, kwiaty, dojrzałe jasne owoce, trochę dobrej piwnicy, zioła, sosna. goryczka umiarkowana do wysokiej. bardzo czystai ziołowa, żywiczna, dość długa. nasycenie umiarkowane do wysokiego.

One day I saw Hop House 13 in Morrisons so bought a 6 pack of bottles and that when noticed it was brewed by Guinness. I can’t stand Guinness but this is nice, not bad and hey the price £2.99 but the question is how long will it remain £2.99 in the pubs. 

I am not going to lie the price is a definite thumbs up but it does taste nice although the taste make you think it is a bitter not a lager, the only reason you know it is classed as a lager is because it says it on the glass.

One of my favourite lagers. Can't really be classed as a craft ale because technically it isn't though it does remind me of one. To me it tastes a little less appealing in cans than the draught or bottled version.  Very drinkable.
Bottle, koszi Petra! Clear golden pour, no head. Nose is malty, herbal and a bit citrusy. Taste ks basically the same, with short finish. Light, almost watery body, average carbo.

Bottle at Peter and Mariskas, 9th March 19.  Pours a dark amber, more so than I expected for the style.  Aroma is caramel, malt, straw.  Taste is sweet, caramel, some bitterness.  Lots is taste for the style

An easy drinking pale lager that verges on craft bit isn’t quite. Had on draft in the local pub, the Bishopton Inn. One of my favourite mainstream lagers, brewed by Guinness. Almost too easy to drink!

330ml. Can. I've been drinking Hop House for sometime, specifically in bottles, also had a few on draught, now had the canned version for about a year. Decided to finally review it! First thing of note is that it is a markedly different tasting beer dependent upon how it is conditioned. This canned version presents a golden colour with little to no head. The aroma is citrus driven, but unusually, this has jammy and raspberry notes. Thin mouthfeel that is slightly drying. Very drinkable lager. But, as something that is massed produced and I've tried numerous, numerous times, it always seems to differ! So, its inconsistency, considering its macro, is rather disconcerting.

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a clear golden orange color forming a big light white head with good persistence that forms and leaves only few thin lingering lacings in the glass. Nose is classic Lager: Strong notes of sweet pale malts. Grass and resin hops profile. Hints of corn, ashes and caramel. Slightly sweet upfront taste. Strong notes of sweet pale malts. Light notes of caramel. Grass and resin hops. Medium sticky hops bitterness. Hints of corn and ashes. Crispy bready, Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Sweet pale malts and grass in the aftertaste. Medium drinkability. Not bad but I was expecting more.
Pours clear golden with decent head. A:  hoppy, T: low/medium carbonation, low/medium body, sharp Bitter with building bitter aftertaste, would use bit more malt flavor to have a balance

Clear copper pour with quickly descending white head. Malt, slightly bready aroma, not a whole lot more. Mildly bitter at first, slowly making place for a sweet finish. Thin to medium mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Nice lager, no complexity though.
A slight step up from run of the mill, big brewery lagers. Fuller, hoppier and tastier than the rivals. Nothing special but drinkable

A soft ale, a bit of caramel taste. A good beer together with food, and also when you just are thursty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Malty, grainy and bready taste, some caramel, herbal hops, hints of grass, some bitterness. Thin body, average carbonation. Surprisingly nice lager.

Ietwat hoppige lager, uit het wereld bier pakket van Gall & Gall. Uit de brouwerij van Guiness. 5,0%. Donkere kleur doet meer vermoeden dan waterige smaak waarmaakt.
at home gold blond colored body with a white head and with a citrus fruity hop aroma a herby hop sweet dry bitter taste with a bitter finish

Terrible taste, aroma of double hopped is a plus but lacks a distinctive citrus taste people tell you about does not do larger any justice tries to hard to topple a Carlsberg or Budweiser. Rockshore is a proper Guinness larger not hop house 13

This is the first time I have tried this Lager.

Tap @ Ten Bells, Londen. De Kroeg waar Jack the ripper zelf ook graag kwam. ;-) Ruikt hoppig smaakt lekker licht hoppig, fruitig, gras waarbij de smaak even blijft hangen. Fantastic lager. Complex and full taste. Great citrus taste, especially grapefruit.

Guinness trying to cover the standard pale lager market with this 'double-hopped lager', a tribute to an old hop store building apparently. Off-white, creamy, fairly thick head leaving large amounts of papery lacing over a cristal clear orangey-hued 'old gold' robe with no visible sparkling, darker than average for the intended style. Aroma of hot ironed cloth - in other words, very dominant pasteurisation, sourish grains and chicken food, damp kitchen towel, moist white pepper from your grandma's spice rack, potato peel, plastic, brown soap, new bicycle tyres, dried out bread crumbs and even a vague note of old dry rusk and soggy peanuts. Neutral onset, some sourish and (more pronounced) sweetish graininess, medium carbonation (quite softish for style actually), very slick, supple mouthfeel. Cereally, admittedly very thinly nutty middle - as in soggy breakfast cereals with a minimal dash of soaking wet peanuts thrown in - with that annoying cooked pasteurisation effect persisting all the way through, yet at the same time admittedly less grainy and more 'rounded' than is custom for an industrial pale lager. Ends only very mildly hoppy with vague floral and grassy notes, effectuating a very late, brief and superficial hop bitterness lingering a bit on the tongue's root but standing no chance against this ongoing blandness of cereally malt sweetishness; plastic- and cooked cloth-like accents as well. The aforementioned hoppiness, in all, remains very subtle and fails to lend the finish any body, rendering it thin and watery. Lazy marketing got the better of Guinness once again: this is a very bland, utterly boring pale lager like there are plenty enough around in the entire world, albeit - and I hate to admit it - perhaps a little bit more hop bitterish and a little bit maltier than average for the dreary yet still commercially dominant style it belongs to. Take note, Guinness executives: in a world where people are increasingly turning to 'craft beer', teach your marketeers not to put "Hop House" or anything else with the word "hop" on your label. This only creates confusion and disappointment, because what you present us with here, is a very cheaply made, bland and artificial pale lager - not at all smelling like 'peach' or 'apricot' like you seem to promise your consumers. Shame on you for lying to them on different levels.

So much craft ale around these days. I have tried very many... you get to the point you just want a nice good pint of honest beer. Hop House 13 is it! Perfect taste, perfect abv, Anyone who thinks otherwise is still on the journey of discovery. I have definitely arrived! It's all I buy nowadays...

Golden colour, medium white head. 
Lightly sweet, medium bite, hay, grass, light citrus and minerals dominate.

Top: medium creamy top with defined rings.

Taste: mild floral hop notes, soft even creamy texture. Raw citrus notes on top end. Nothing special here.

330ml bottle

Into a Guinness FE Stout glass at just on cool. Settles a thinly looking, translucent medium gold. Foam sets out as a thin island of white atop. Light bodied but cumbersome. Spritzy in carbonation. Dusty, stale hop late. Not much as far as hop potential. Lengthy sweet grain. Not much going on. Sessionable, but boring and one dimensional. Nothing special, but ideal for a blindingly hot day in a beer garden.

Taste is malty with no real bitterness. Light body. Smooth with a moderately long malty finish.

mais sans aucune complexité.

Mass produced generic beers flooding the market in an effort to keep the little guy breweries off the radar. Draught. Honey gold with a thin head. Aroma is honey lemon. Flavour is sweet, mango marmalade, a little bitterness in the finish, oily texture, quite like a sweet German Helles.

Bottle 0,33ltr: Clear golden colored brew with an lightly sweet bitter taste with an very slightly hints of caramel. Something else then their usual black stuff i like so much, this one is not that bad.
Backlog from Irland. Tap. Aroma of malty toffee, grain, floral and grassy. Light sweet and bitter. Average
Clear dark golden beer with small white head. Aroma is toasted malts, grain. Taste is medium sweet and modest bitter. Dry finish. Overall descent beer with modest aroma and quite ok taste.

Pours a dark yellow with a thick white head that leaves lacing. Medium body. Nose is light malt. Taste is light malt pils with a touch of amber (?) malt. Hops come through with slight bitterness. 11.2 oz bottle  Bottled 2/13/17
Lys brun klar med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Lite lukt, noe eple og korn. Lett. Vannete. Noe honning, blomster og maltekstrakt. Kort

Bottle. Opens easily and pours nicely. I think this is quite dark for a lager. A lovely clear golden coppery colour. Minimal white head. The aroma has hints of fruit and malt and a touch of earthiness. The taste is malty with light to medium bitterness. Good body and decent finish. Better than I thought it was going to be.

Dégustée à l'été 2017 (De mes notes).                                                                                                                                                                        .

I don't know if Guinness have changed the recipe. But over the last few months this beer has lost all the taste and freshness that it originally had. When this beer was launched it had a lovely hoppy taste and I was surprised when I found out that it was made by Guinness. 

I don't drink lager very often these days
 But on a very hot day a month or two ago I had an "ice cold in Alex" moment and needed a cold lager. It was my first pint of this for a while and it was horrible. I've tried a few more in different pubs but the taste has definitely changed and you may as well drink Foster's or Carling.

Don't know why or when they downgraded the beer but they have and have ruined a lovely beer.
Not bad in the grander scheme of lagers. A light bit of pine but otherwise a clean finish like deck carpentry. Golden pour. Bottle.

may canning. pours crystal clear gold with a small creamy and reviving white head offering some retention and lacing. lightly toasted cereals/grains/malts, faint but present toffee, underlying lagering fruitiness, few bitter citrus rinds, relatively clean yeast action - english-like, it seems. moderate carbonation, light body, relatively dry grassy-citrusy-herbal finish. amongst stupid and false macro-lagers, this offering proves that fat breweries can still produce lagers with a minimum in quality.

33cl Bottle from Vonk. Clear golden amber colour, white head. Aroma of grain, toast, hint of lemon. Flavour is light to medium sweet, light malty, toast, hint of caramel, light lemon peel, grain, soft bitter finish. Light bodied. Not great tbh.
on tap oro limpida leggero maltato lupoolatura praticamente assente poco aroma solo un po dolciastra

Goudgeel tegen Amber, witte schuimkraag, helder, rustig koolzuur.
Aroma: Licht moutig, biscuit, licht fruitig, Citrus, manderijn, zoetig en gras.
Smaak: Direct lekker fruitig, zoete mouten, licht gehopt, iets spicy en een refelijke bitter. Vind hem helemaal niet onaardig.... er zijn zoveel slechtere lagers.
Lichte body, zacht koolzuur, fris, afdronk is fruitig en licht bitter.
Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is grainy malt, cereal, with a hint of hops and peach. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Body is medium. Only a hint of hops, but not a terrible Lager.
pale light copper body. Nice White foam. low low bitterness without flavorurs. low carbonation. Maybe a little error with the pub's service.
On tap at the Spitfire Southampton. Pours clear golden. Highly carbonated. Aroma of malt with hops. Sweet taste and finish.

Liquide doré. Mince voile. Un nez de jus de pommes, de malt et d’herbes fraîches. Des saveurs râpeuses, de gazon, de foin et d’alcool. Une faible effervescence et un sentiment de déjà vu des centaines de fois. (2292-080817)

500ml can. Golden, perfectly clear, sports a large creamy cap. Malty nose with bread and grains. Taste is lightly toasty with some citrus hop accents, bit of a bitter finish and citrus remaining on the tongue. Better than I expected.
Aroma is malts and a hint of berry/adjuncts. The flavor is malts, mild citrus hops and a beery/adjunct finish.
On tap at Belfast airport. Pours golden color, nearly no head. Aroma of malt. Taste is medium sweet, malty, some citrusy hops. Boring.
Tap @ The Green, Shepherd’s Bush, London, 20/07/17. Grainy and crisp lager.

After being starved for good beer in some other places in Europe, I can appreciate even average beer so much more

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I am a massive Guinness fan. They have nailed it again. From the first sip to the last it’s engulfs your tongue with waves of deep rich flavour. The after taste is strong and mellow out for you to taste the nice fruity notes

I dislike Guinness but I like this. It has a certain distinctiveness that warms my cockles to the core.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - pours deep, bright golden with lots of bubbles. Fizzy, clean white head with good retention and good lacing. Aroma of some light tropical fruits and blackcurrant, lemon, hints of corn and candy floss. Taste is malty, earthy, slight hint of alcohol, some toffee and medium to light bitterness. Medium to light body, medium carbonation, watery mouthfeel. Pleasantly surprised by how nice this was.

Robe blonde, léger caramel, limpide, moyenne mousse blanche. Nez malté, caramel, toffée. Bouche légère de malt en attaque et rapidement houblon herbeux avec une pointe d’amertume. Légère en corps et en alcool, faible longueur, bonne carbo. Bof bof, bue ne bouteille et m’avait semblée bien meilleure à la pression à Dublin...

I had it from the bottle. The aroma is caramel and faint hops. The taste is caramel, hops, and some citrus. This was nicely balanced, dry, and refreshing. It was definitely sessionable. I was pleasantly surprised.
Amber in colour. Sort of a sweaty aroma. Very watery taste of malt and honey, a bit more flavourful than your average lager though. Not much depth at all. Best overall qualifier would be "not awful."

Draught as ½ pint at Flying Horse (JDW) Gatwick, on June 27, 2017.
Clear golden color, white head. Light malty, some cream taste. Fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Malty, clean scent.
Lacks character.
5/3/6/2/10=2.6

Fass 0,5l: Golden, leichte Trübung, etwas feinporiger Schaum; milde malzige Nase, etwas Getreide, Brot, dezente Hopfenaromen, leichte Zitrusnoten; milder Körper, Malz, etwas Malzzucker, Getreide, leichte Zitrusnoten, dezente Hopfennoten, spritzig, deutliche Kohlensäure; sehr leichter milder Nachgang

Draft@Dublin, Ireland. Amber beer with a good head. The aroma is gently hopped, and the flavour is hopped and bitter with gentle malts and yeastiness. Overall a nice pale lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rating the bottled version. A nice looking lager, deep golden with a good white head. Aroma is grassy with some sweet biscuit malt, quite nice. Medium bodied, malty flavours with some gentle hops. This is OK, I’d rather have this than most of the mass produced lager style stuff that’s available. I tried the draught version in the Crusoe Hotel in Lower Largo a while back and it was OK as well!

S: light citrus, honey A: orange, minimal head, clear T: med bitterness P: refreshing, slightly hoppy
